About


I started my development journey in middle school learning HTML3 through a web design elective. In high school, I moved on to learning Java for two years and took the Computer Science AP Exam which followed an Introductory CS course from Central Connecticut State University (CS 151 Bradley Kjell). I wasn't too sure about my career path during high school as I did look into video game development, computer engineering, cinematography or computer science. Once I graduated High School, I entered the University of Nevada Las Vegas to focus on Computer Engineering. Later to find out that the field wasn't for me and that I actually missed programming, thus I switched my major to Computer Science. I learned many Object-Oreiented languages such as C++, Java, and C# however, the ciriculum only focused on aspects that I wasn't to interested in. I'm a creator and artist at heart. My whole life I've always been creative and took on many aspects of art as a hobby like photography, drawing, cinematography, digital design, etc. I wanted to design and create something visually appealing but my University's curriculum didn't have much of the sort. I learned a few things about video game development in a Computer Graphics course, but that was different from what I expected. I looked into many different pathways of computer science and I was very passionate about taking the path of web development, more specifically front end and once I have more experience under the belt a full stack developer.

Projects


Blackjack Version 1

Project was primarily done with Javascript and lacked reponsiveness throughout the application. Game is fully functional with rematch capabilities, score counter, hand count, and all Blackjack functionalities. Game is fair with every game starting with a newly shuffled deck. Currently remaking this game with ReactJS. Github Try it out here!


Quark

Quark is a particle engine/library that I helped create with a few collegues from college during our Senior Design class. We were tasked to create a particle engine with our professors Evidence based language Quorum. Basically everything from scratch except the objects used, we created a functional library with particle and particle emitter properites and a particle editor that creates and saves properties of a particle via JSON. Bitbucket | Video Demo


Materialize Portfolio

Primarily started learing Materialize as I was looking for CSS frameworks to learn and Bootstrap was starting to become obsolete. This Materialized Portfolio is just a remake of this current portfilio. Github Check it out here!


Studio Ghibli API APP

An early project of mine to learn the use of APIs. With the used of the Studio Ghibli API, I created an app that lists all the movies and a quick description about them. Github


Clock app

A basic clock application I created when I started learning JavaScript. Based on the time of day, the wallpaper changes. Github Check it out here!
